title: How has the proportion of Red 1 and 2 calls attended within 8 minutes varied by commissioning region?
analysis_commentary:
The proportion of category A calls attended within eight minutes varies over time at the regional level in a similar manner to the national level, although London tends towards more extreme peaks and troughs. London was last above target in March of 2014. There was a general decline in performance across all regions from April 2014. The last region to exceed the target was the north, in May 2015, and no region hasÂ  exceeded the target since. As of January 2017, the north was the poorest performing region with just 57% of category A calls attended within eight minutes.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
